quote: Words save our lives, sometimes.
author: Neil Gaiman,  The Ocean at the End of the Lane

quote: It's only words... unless they're true.
author: David Mamet

quote: Words are, like wines.
author: Santosh Kalwar,  You Can

quote: Words are the clothes thoughts wear.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Words are a pretext. It is the inner bond that draws one person to another, not words.
author: Rumi

quote: And what is wrong with playing with words? Words love to be played with, just like children or kittens do!
author: David Almond,  My Name Is Mina

quote: I never met a word I didn't love
author: Gail Carson Levine

quote: Having Words with Words [10w] ”I’ve had a falling out with words,leaving me speechless.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: I have hated words and I have loved them, and I hope I have made them right.
author: Markus Zusak,  The Book Thief

quote: I'm bored with it all. - Last Words
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: We live and breathe words.
author: Cassandra Clare,  Clockwork Prince

quote: Kind words change the world.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: A picture is worth a thousand words.
author: Unknown

quote: All words are pegs to hang ideas on.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Where do the words gowhen we have said them?
author: Margaret Atwood,  Procedures For Underground

quote: I like using big words. Words like huge, gigantic, massive.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the story my great-grandfather told my father, who then told my grandfather, who then told me about how The Mythical Mr. Boo, Charles Manseur Fizzlebush Grissham III, better known as Mr. Fizzlebush, and Orafoura are all in fact me...

quote: Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts.
author: Patrick Rothfuss,  The Name of the Wind

quote: Words are directed to your personalities namely; - God, your hearers, devil and yourself.
author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper

quote: A word after a word after a word is power.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Words of love, are works of love.
author: William R. Alger

quote: I am telling you what I know—words have music and if you are a musician you will write to hear them.
author: E.L. Doctorow

quote: Words bounce. Words, if you let them, will do what they want to do and what they have to do.
author: Anne Carson,  Autobiography of Red

quote: The best of us must sometimes eat our words.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: ...if you do not even understand what words say,how can you expect to pass judgementon what words conceal?
author: H.D.,  Trilogy: The Walls Do Not Fall / Tribute to the Angels / The Flowering of the Rod

quote: Who needs a large vocabulary when you can just make up any word at any time? It makes life a whole lot more emeaglibop.
author: Jarod Kintz,  How to construct a coffin with six karate chops

quote: The 3 Most Powerful Words in the English Language for Every College Student [3w] Ilovepizza
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Broadly speaking, the short words are the best, and the old words best of all.
author: Winston S. Churchill,  Never Give In!: The Best of Winston Churchill's Speeches

quote: Here's a funny question:What is your favorite word?Think about it—maybe it's a word that makes you absolutely happy, or a word that sounds gloriously beautiful, or a word that evokes awe and wonder. Maybe you are reminded of a great time when you hear it, or maybe it represents your life's dream.So, what is it? What is your favorite word of all words?Thought about it yet?Good.And now, think why.
author: Vera Nazarian,  The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration

quote: I know all those words, but that sentence makes no sense to me.
author: Matt Groening

quote: Every word first looks around in every direction before letting itself be written down by me.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: All words are masks and the lovelier they are, the more they are meant to conceal.
author: Steven Millhauser

quote: Poetry: the best words in the best order.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Words - so innocent and powerless as they are, as standing in a dictionary, how potent for good and evil they become in the hands of one who knows how to combine them.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Wordplay hides a key to reality that the dictionary tries in vain to lock inside every free word.
author: Julio Cortázar,  Around the Day in Eighty Worlds

quote: Rather than words comes the thought of high windows:The sun-comprehending glass,And beyond it, the deep blue air, that showsNothing, and is nowhere, and is endless.
author: Philip Larkin,  High Windows

quote: Words are like eggs dropped from great heights; you can no more call them back than ignore the mess they leave when they fall.
author: Jodi Picoult,  Salem Falls

quote: There are no bad words. Bad thoughts. Bad intentions, and wooooords.
author: George Carlin

quote: Cheapen words and they'll cheapen you
author: Benny Bellamacina

quote: Strong words outlast the paper they are written upon.
author: Joseph Bruchac,  Code Talker: A Novel About the Navajo Marines of World War Two

quote: I love words. I crave descriptions that overwhelm my imagination with vivid detail. I dwell on phrases that make my heart thrum. I cherish expressions that pierce my emotions and force the tears to spill over. In essence, I long for a writer's soul sealed in ink on the page.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich

quote: Words are tears that have been written down. Tears are words that need to be shed. Without them, joy loses all its brilliance and sadness has no end.
author: Paulo Coelho,  Aleph

quote: With words at your disposal, you can see more clearly. Finding the words is another step in learning to see.
author: Robin Wall Kimmerer

quote: She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.
author: Michael Ondaatje,  The English Patient

quote: One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple.
author: Jack Kerouac,  The Dharma Bums

quote: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Words are easy, like the wind; Faithful friends are hard to find.
author: William Shakespeare,  The Passionate Pilgrim

quote: Thought before word, never word before thought.
author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: Every word was once a poem.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Don't gobblefunk around with words.
author: Roald Dahl,  The BFG

quote: I like good strong words that mean something…
author: Louisa May Alcott,  Little Women
